questions.text: A 24-Year-old woman with nine weeks of amenorrhea presents with a history of severe abdomen pain and bleeding pv for one day. She has no comorbidities. She is on progesterone-only pill contraception. No history of comorbidities. On examination, P-110/min, BP-114/76mmHg, temperature 99F, saturation normal, RR-14/min, pallor present. Abdominal examination shows tenderness. PV examination shows a bleed; no other findings are present. USG was advised and showed a ruptured tubal ectopic. Beta hCG levels were analyzed?

options.label: B
options.text: Manage this condition Follow up with beta hCG

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Resuscitation and laparotomy The altered vitals of the female indicate hypotensive shock, which points towards a diagnosis of ruptured ectopic . Resuscitation and laparotomy with tubectomy is the appropriate step in managing this patient.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options B and C: are done in cases of medical management of unruptured ectopic.

questions.text: A 25-Year-old nulliparous female came with amenorrhoea of 8 weeks with mild pain in the abdomen. Her serum beta HCG level was 2000 mIU/l. Her obstetrician advised her USG, which showed the following findings. Which of the following could be the probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ectopic pregnancy The clinical scenario is of a middle-aged female with pain and amenorrhea . It increased beta HCG with ultrasound showing empty gestational sac points towards the diagnosis of unruptured ectopic pregnancy.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. A case of abortion primarily presents with bleeding per vagina and lower abdominal pain. USG shows no signs of abortion. Option: C. Vesicular mole is characterized by the passage of grape-like cysts per vaginam. USG can show snowstorm appearance Option: D. The classic symptoms of PID are pain in the abdomen with a temperature rise.

questions.text: A 25-Year-old woman with eight weeks of amenorrhea presents with a history of pain abdomen and bleeding pv. Her UPT is positive. She has no comorbidities. Serum hCG levels were 1200IU/L. On examination, P-100/min, BP -110/72mmHg, RR-19/min, afebrile, saturation normal, pallor present. Abdominal examination shows tenderness. Using showed tubal ectopic unruptured with no collections. True statements about this condition are all except?

options.label: A
options.text: In the case of Rh-negative women, anti - D gamma globulin should be administered

options.label: C
options.text: Persistent cases may occur due to incomplete removal of trophoblast

questions.explanation:
Solution:

None of the above The case concerns a middle-aged female with pain, amenorrhea, and increased HCG levels, pointing toward a diagnosis of ectopic Her vitals are unstable, which leads to hypotensive shock, which suggests the ectopic is ruptured . All the statements are factual concerning ruptured ectopic . Hence option D is correct.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. In Rh-negative women not yet sensitized to Rh antigen, anti-D gamma globulin— 50 µg (if gestation < 12 weeks) or 300 mugs (if > 12 weeks) intramuscularly is administered soon following an operation to prevent isoimmunization. Option: B. An ectopic mother has every chance of a viable birth in 1 in 3 and a chance of recurrence of ectopic in 1 in 10 . The patient is asked to report after she misses her period to confirm and locate the new pregnancy. Option: C. Persistent ectopic pregnancy is due to incomplete removal of the trophoblast. Prophylactic single dose MTX (1 mg/kg) IM is adequate to resolve the problem.

questions.text: A 26-Year-old female with six weeks of amenorrhea presents with pain abdomen, vomiting, and syncope. She is on progesterone-only pills for contraception. She has a history of previous induced abortions due to contraceptive failure. No history of comorbidities present. On examination, P-98/min, BP-114/72mmHg, RR-19/min, temperature-100F, saturation normal, pallor present. Abdominal examination shows the presence of diffuse tenderness. PV examination shows bleed pv. UPT is positive. USG shows tubal ectopic with no cardiac activity and collection of fluid in the surrounding area with signs of inflammation. The etiology of this condition could be 1. Pelvic inflammatory diseases 2. Combined oral contraceptives 3. Prior induced abortion 4. Diabetes mellitus Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1 and 3 The given case is of a middle-aged female with pain, amenorrhea, and increased HCG levels, which points toward a diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy.

Highyeild:

Risk factors for ectopic pregnancy: Previous H/O ectopic pregnancy Pelvic infections /salpingitis/STD Peritubal adhesions after salpingitis, appendicitis, or endometriosis Infertility treatment (IVF) Smoker Progesterone contraceptives (Progestasert, Mirena, POP). This is because progesterone is a skeletal muscle relaxant. Statement 2: All contraceptives reduce the risk of ectopic pregnancy (except Progesterone contraceptives). Among them, OCP has the least risk . Statement 4: Diabetes has no association with ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: A 30-Year-old G2P1 presents at six weeks gestation by last menstrual period complaining of pelvic pain and nausea. Her beta HCG is 3010 mIU/ml, and no intrauterine pregnancy is seen on ultrasound. No adnexal mass or free fluid is visualized. What is the best management strategy?
questions.correct_answer: D. Expectant management with 48hr follow up
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Expectant management with 48hr follow up The female presents with six weeks of amenorrhea , pain, and an empty gestational sac . The differential diagnosis of such a presentation can be an ectopic pregnancy or a case of missed abortion . The next best step is to follow up with HCG levels in 48 hours to differentiate between the two. In case of missed abortion, the levels of HCG reduce , while in the case of ectopic, the levels increase after 48 hours.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. The patient cannot be sent home without any intervention as it can lead to complications later, like a rupture in case of ectopic pregnancy. Option: B. Surgical management is done in a ruptured ectopic pregnancy. Option: C. Methotrexate can be given only after the diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy has been made.

questions.text: A 35-Year-old woman married for five years reported in the emergency department with complaints of amenorrhoea for one and ½ months and painless vaginal bleeding and had taken treatment for infertility. On examination, abdomens are soft and non-tender, with no guarding or rigidity. In a PV examination, the cervix is bigger than the size of the fundus cervix ballooned up on ultrasound. The uterine cavity is empty, and the gestational sac, placental tissue in the cervical canal, and the internal OS are closed. The most likely diagnosis and criteria used are?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cervical pregnancy, Rubin's criteria. The female presents with six weeks of amenorrhea with an empty gestational sac . Her cervix is larger than the fundus, suggesting it be a cervical ectopic pregnancy.

Extraedge:

Palman and Rubin's criteria for cervical ectopic: Uterine bleeding without cramping pain following a period of amenorrhoea. A soft, enlarged cervix equal to or larger than the fundus (hourglass appearance of the uterus). Products of conception entirely located within and firmly attached to the endocervical canal. A closed internal os . A partially opened external os .

questions.text: A 38 year old female, G5P1L0A3, came to obgy OPD with amenorrhoea of 8 weeks with abdominal pain. She gives the history of taking ART treatment for conception. Her obstetrician advised an ultrasound which revealed the following: Uterus showing gestational sac with fetal pole and cardiac activity present. Also, a 2x2 cm gestational sac-like mass in the left adnexa shows no cardiac activity. Which of the following statement is correct regarding this case: 1. This is a case of heterotypic pregnancy 2. Ectopic pregnancy should be dealt with. KCl in the ectopic g sac while uterine pregnancy should be allowed to continue 3. The ectopic pregnancy should be medically managed with a single dose of. methotrexate 50 mg/m2 while uterine pregnancy should be allowed to continue 4. Laparoscopic removal of the ectopic pregnancy Selects the correct answer from the code below:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1,2,4 In the given case, two simultaneous pregnancies occur: one in the uterus and one in the ectopic. This is called heterotypic ( Statement 1 ) Statement 2: The size of the ectopic gestation is less than 4 cm with no cardiac activity, so this can be managed within . KCl while uterine pregnancy should be allowed to continue Statement 3: methotrexate is a category x drug and can’t be given in this case because of the coexisting viable intrauterine pregnancy Statement 4: Laparoscopic removal of ectopic gestation with close follow-up is also one of the options that can be tried in this case

questions.text: A G3P1L1A1 female of 32 years of age, with a repeated history of PID, came to you with lactational amenorrhoea with UPT positive. All of the following will favor you considering the diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy in this patient except?

options.label: A
options.text: Associated lower abdominal pain with per vaginal bleeding

options.label: B
options.text: Evening rise of fever since last three days

options.label: C
options.text: No gestational sac seen in the uterine cavity on USG

questions.correct_answer: B. Evening rise of fever since last three days
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Evening rise of fever since last three days Fever is usually not a symptom of ectopic Fever is associated with the case of infections/ PID.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A and C: A case of ectopic pregnancy usually presents as pain and amenorrhea in a middle-aged female with an empty gestational sac. Option: D. Previous history of ectopic pregnancy is the most critical risk factor in a case of ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: All of the following modes of contraception are risk factor for ectopic pregnancy except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

C Contraceptive devices, in general, reduce the risk of pregnancy, so they reduce the risk of ectopic pregnancy as well EXCEPT Copper IUCDs, POP, Progestasert, Tubal ligation. These are risk factors for ectopic pregnancy.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Shows an image of copper IUCD, Option: B. Is Progestasert Option: D. Is an image of tubal ligation . All three are risk factors for ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: Among women who were pregnant while using contraception, the relative number of ectopic pregnancies increased with which of the following contraceptives?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Progestin-releasing intrauterine device Progesterone in progestin- only pill causes decreased tubal motility, causing implantation in the fallopian tube resulting in ectopic pregnancy. Contraceptive devices, in general, reduce the risk of pregnancy, so they also reduce the risk of ectopic pregnancy, EXCEPT Copper IUCDs, POP, Progestasert, and Tubal ligation. These are risk factor for ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: Ectopic pregnancy is most commonly associated with:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tubal inflammatory diseases Ectopic is related to PID, which leads to tubal inflammation.

Highyeild:

Risk factors for ectopic pregnancy: Previous H/O ectopic pregnancy Pelvic infections /salpingitis/STD Peritubal adhesions after salpingitis, appendicitis, or endometriosis Infertility treatment (IVF) Smoker Progesterone contraceptives (Progestasert, Mirena, POP). This is because progesterone is a skeletal muscle relaxant.

questions.text: In ectopic pregnancies, the absence of which tubal tissue layer facilitates rapid invasion of proliferating trophoblasts into the muscular?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Submucosa Because the fallopian tube lacks a submucosal layer, the fertilized ovum burrows through the epithelium. The zygote comes to lie near or within the muscular, which is invaded by a rapidly increasing trophoblast. The embryo or fetus in an ectopic pregnancy is often absent or stunted.

questions.text: Match the following
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A-2, B-2, C-3, D-1

questions.text: The most common manifestation of ectopic pregnancy is?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pain abdomen The classical case of ectopic pregnancy presents with pain in the abdomen with If her vitae are deranged, which leads to hypotensive shock , it's a ruptured pregnancy.

questions.text: The cause of maternal death in ectopic pregnancy is postulated as:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vascular accident Ruptured ectopic pregnancy presents with deranged vitals and hypotensive shock . Ectopic pregnancy is the leading cause of early pregnancy-related deaths. A Most common cause of death in ectopic pregnancy is tubal rupture → severe hemorrhage, → death.

Highyeild:

Ectopic pregnancy can have two outcomes: Tubal abortion – M/C outcome. Most common outcome income is ectopic pregnancy in the ampulla, which ended by Tubal abortion Tubal rupture– ectopic pregnancy of isthmus are the ones which usually rupture.

questions.text: The following type of decidual sloughing is seen in:

options.label: B
options.text: Molar pregnancy and pelvic inflammatory disease

options.label: C
options.text: Ectopic pregnancy and pelvic inflammatory disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Ectopic pregnancy and uterine abortion.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ectopic pregnancy and uterine abortion. Given image is of a decidual cast . Decidua is an endometrium that is hormonally prepared for pregnancy. The entire sloughed endometrium takes the form of the endometrial cavity. In the case of ectopic pregnancy, decidua is passed along with vaginal bleeding. Decidual cast is also seen in uterine abortions

questions.text: The sonographic finding image can be seen with which of the following condition(s)

options.label: C
options.text: Corpus luteum cyst and ectopic pregnancy.

questions.correct_answer: C. Corpus luteum cyst and ectopic pregnancy.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Corpus luteum cyst and ectopic pregnancy. The sonographic finding is a ring of fire on color Doppler. The ring of fire reflects placental blood flow around the periphery of the pregnancy. Arias Stella's reaction is a benign change in the endometrium due to the action of the progesterone family of hormones. It is a histological finding. It is seen in normal , ectopic, and molar pregnancy.

questions.text: What is the classical triad of clinical symptoms of an ectopic pregnancy?

options.label: B
options.text: Delayed menstruation, pain, and vaginal bleeding.

options.label: C
options.text: Dizziness, delayed menstruation, and vaginal bleeding.

options.label: D
options.text: Shoulder pain, delayed menstruation, and vaginal bleeding.

questions.correct_answer: B. Delayed menstruation, pain, and vaginal bleeding.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Delayed menstruation, pain, and vaginal bleeding. Ectopic pregnancy presents as pain in the abdomen (not shoulder), and amenorrhea (delayed menstruation). If it's a ruptured ectopic, it also presents as vaginal bleeding, leading to hypovolemic shock and death. Hence option c is most appropriate here.

questions.text: What is the single best predictor of successful treatment with single dose methotrexate?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Beta HCG

Highyeild:

Single dose Medical treatment protocol for ectopic pregnancy Day 0/Day I= Measure serum ß-hCG, TLC, DLC, Liver Function Test and Renal Function Test Day 2 = Single dose Methotrexate 50 mg/m² IM given Day 4 = S. B-hCG and counts repeated Day 7 = S. B-hCG and counts repeated Now if the decline in serum ẞhCG on Day 7 from day 4 is- ≥ 15% ↓ No further treatment is required BhCG levels are repeated weekly until detectable <15%/Fetal cardiac activity present ↓ Repeat methotrexate dose and begin new Day 1 ↓ Surgical treatment is indicated if B-hCG levels not decreasing or fetal cardiac activity persists m after three doses of methotrexate

questions.text: Which is the most frequent site for ectopic pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2 Ampulla is the most frequent site for ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding the medical management of ectopic pregnancy: 1. Size of the gestational sac should be less than 4 cm 2. No evidence of hemoperitoneum 3. The patient is having symptoms of shock 4. Maximum two doses of methotrexate can be given. Select the correct answer from the code below:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Only 1 and 2 Indications of medical management: Patient should be hemodynamically stable (Rule out statement 3 ) Patients should be asymptomatic , motivated, and compliant. (Rule out statement 2 ) Beta HCG levels <3000 Units Absent cardiac activity Size of gestational sac <4 cm ( Statement 1 ) Maximum three doses of methotrexate have been given. ( Statement 4 )
